definition: tired of/fed up/sick/(of a person) to annoy/tiresome
taste/smell/(fig.) (noun suffix) feel/quality/sense/(TCM) classifier for ingredients of a medicine prescription

sentences.english: Until then I've been bored by everythellong associated with English courses.
sentences.chinese: 在這以前，我對於所有跟英文課沾邊的事都感應膩味。

sentences.english: His dull speeches often underwhelm his audiences.
sentences.chinese: 他的枯燥的講話常常使聽衆感到膩味。

sentences.english: When I hear the word 'football' I switch off.
sentences.chinese: 我聽見“足球”兩個字就膩味。

sentences.english: Do you mean that you'd fed up with Western means of artistic expression?
sentences.chinese: 您是說膩味了西方藝術的手法嗎？

sentences.english: And I already spend enough time on the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 至於上網，我已經有些膩味了。

sentences.english: I hate fatty pork and never eat any.
sentences.chinese: 我最膩味肥肉，從來不喫。

sentences.english: I'm tired of you guys' chin music.
sentences.chinese: 你們這些傢伙山南海北地胡侃，我已膩味透啦。

sentences.english: I give up. I can't stand it any longer.
sentences.chinese: 我活膩味了，我要放棄，我再也無法忍受了。

sentences.english: Until then I'd been bored by everything associated with English courses.
sentences.chinese: 在這之前，我對所有跟英文課沾邊的事感到膩味。
